item.title: Touch Pins as Wake-up Source (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
Wake the ESP32 from deep sleep by using the touch sensors. This is handy if you want to respond to someone touching your device and turning it on.
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

item.title: Why ESP32's Are The Best Microcontrollers (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
The ESP32 is a very powerful microcontroller with built-in WiFi and Bluetooth, a dual-core CPU and a lot of memory.
In this video I'll go over all of the features and explain why it's possibly the best chip to use for your next IoT project!
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

Become a Simply Explained member: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnxrdFPXJMeHru_b4Q_vTPQ/join
item.author: (Simply Explained - Savjee)

item.title: ESP32: Blink the LED (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
It's the "Hello World" of IoT projects: blink an LED. Here, I'll show you how to blink the built-in LED of most ESP32 development boards. Of course, by using Arduino framework.
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

item.title: Install Serial Drivers for ESP32 (macOS, Windows, Linux)
item.description:
Before you can program the ESP32, you need to install a driver for the USB-to-UART chip. Depending on your board that might be the CH340 or CP210x chip.
üîó Driver download links: - CH340 (Windows & Linux): https://learn.sparkfun.com/tutorials/how-to-install-ch340-drivers/all - CH340 (macOS): https://github.com/adrianmihalko/ch340g-ch34g-ch34x-mac-os-x-driver
- CP210x (Windows, macOS & Linux): https://www.silabs.com/products/development-tools/software/usb-to-uart-bridge-vcp-drivers
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)
üåç Social Twitter: https://twitter.com/Savjee Facebook: https://facebook.com/Savjee Blog: https://savjee.be

item.author: (Simply Explained - Savjee)

item.title: Using the PlatformIO Library Manager (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
Use PlatformIO's dependency manager to automatically install and update any Arduino library you want to use.
No need to code everything yourself because there are so many Arduino libraries available for various sensors and devices. LCD display? Temperature sensor? A library probably exists already!
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

item.title: Using Arduino's Serial Monitor & Plotter (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
Quickly debug your sketches with the Arduino Serial Monitor. See the value of variables and learn how to use the built-in plotter of the Arduino IDE.
I've used this countless of times to visualize values of a new sensor that I'm testing. Seeing data in visual way is often much easier to interpret and make sense of.
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

item.title: Using DHT22 Temperature Sensor (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
Measure temperature and humidity with the DHT22 (AM2302) sensor. This is a cheap & accurate sensor that integrates easily into many IoT projects.
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

item.title: Deep sleep: Use RTC memory to store data (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
In deep sleep, the ESP32 powers down its main memory so all the contents is lost. You can, however, save some data in RTC memory. This is kept powered on during deep sleep and is ideal to keep some data around for when the ESP32 wakes up later.
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)
üåç Social Twitter: https://twitter.com/Savjee Facebook: https://facebook.com/Savjee Blog: https://savjee.be
Become a Simply Explained member: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnxrdFPXJMeHru_b4Q_vTPQ/join
item.author: (Simply Explained - Savjee)

item.title: How To Install PlatformIO (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
Setting up PlatformIO inside Visual Studio Code for ESP32 development.
PlatformIO is just an extension to Visual Studio Code and includes a library manager, a debugger and more!
üîóUseful links: - PlatformIO homepage: https://platformio.org/
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU

item.title: Controlling Relay Board (ESP32 + Arduino Series)
item.description:
Relays allow you to control high-voltage devices like a light bulb or outlet. You can also use them to operate garage doors or curtain motors.
They are easy to connect & easy to control with an ESP32. Make a project to control the lights via WiFi? No problem for the ESP32!
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

item.title: Connect ESP32 to WiFi (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
Learn how to connect your ESP32 to your WiFi network. This is the biggest advantage of the ESP32: built-in WiFi.
Once you have a WiFi connection, you can use it to send data to internet services such as ThingSpeak, AWS IoT, ...
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

item.title: Connect to ThingSpeak (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
Use the built-in WiFi to send data to ThingSpeak. This could be temperature readings, water levels, lux levels, ...
ThingSpeak is free if you send less than 3 million messages per year. Ideal for DIY projects.
üîó Useful links: - ThingSpeak homepage: https://thingspeak.com/
- Arduino library for ThingSpeak: https://github.com/mathworks/thingspeak-arduino
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

item.title: Why Use PlatformIO instead of Arduino? (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
The Arduino IDE is great, but also limited. Here I'll talk about using PlatformIO as a more powerful alternative.
üîóUseful links: - PlatformIO homepage: https://platformio.org/
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)

item.title: Deep Sleep & Other Power Modes (ESP32 + Arduino Series)
item.description:
The ESP32 can consume a lot of power when you keep it running at full speed. Here, I'll go over all the different modes that allow you to reduce power consumption and save your battery.
The best way is by using one of the sleep modes, such as Deep Sleep mode. In this mode, the entire CPU is powered down and only a clock is running so the board can wakeup after a certain period of time.
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)
üåç Social Twitter: https://twitter.com/Savjee Facebook: https://facebook.com/Savjee Blog: https://savjee.be
Become a Simply Explained member: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnxrdFPXJMeHru_b4Q_vTPQ/join
item.author: (Simply Explained - Savjee)

item.title: Wakeup From Sleep With a Timer (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
You can't let the ESP32 be in deep sleep forever. At some point you need to wake it up and the easiest way is by using a timer.
Learn how to configure your board so it will automatically wakeup after a certain periode of time. For instance: you can sleep for 15 minutes, wakeup, make a temperature measurement and go back to deep sleep.
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)
üåç Social Twitter: https://twitter.com/Savjee Facebook: https://facebook.com/Savjee Blog: https://savjee.be
Become a Simply Explained member: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnxrdFPXJMeHru_b4Q_vTPQ/join
item.author: (Simply Explained - Savjee)

item.title: Setting up Arduino IDE for ESP32 development (ESP32 + Arduino series)
item.description:
By default, the Arduino IDE has no support for the ESP32. In this video I'll show how to install the necessary software to make it compatible.
üîóUseful links - Arduino IDE download: https://www.arduino.cc/en/main/software
- Official Espressif install instructions: https://github.com/espressif/arduino-esp32/blob/master/docs/arduino-ide/boards_manager.md
- Arduino Framework for ESP32 (source code): https://github.com/espressif/arduino-esp32
‚ö°Ô∏èOther videos in this series: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLzvRQMJ9HDiQ3OIuBWCEW6yE0S0LUWhGU
(Everything you need to know about programming the ESP32 by using the Arduino Framework)
